etymologies: late 17th century; earliest use found in Ralph Cudworth (1617–1688), philosopher and theologian. From post-classical Latin pseudepigraphus falsely ascribed to an author, spurious or its etymon Hellenistic Greek ψευδεπίγραϕος with false title, not genuine (from ancient Greek ψευδ- + ἐπιγράϕειν to inscribe) + -ous, after pseudepigrapha
